an5.159:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery.
an5.159:4.3: Now, at that time Venerable Udāyī was sitting teaching Dharma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.
an5.159:4.6: bowed, sat down to one side,
an5.159:4.8: “Sir, Venerable Udāyī is teaching Dharma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.”
an5.159:5.1: “Ānanda, it’s not easy to teach Dharma to others.
an5.159:5.2: You should establish five things in yourself before teaching Dharma to others.
an5.159:5.4: You should teach Dharma to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ …
an5.159:5.7: ‘I will not talk while secretly hoping to profit.’ …
an5.159:5.8: ‘I will talk without hurting myself or others.’
an5.159:5.9: It’s not easy to teach Dharma to others.
an5.159:5.10: You should establish these five things in yourself before teaching Dharma to others.”
